title: 109_hr4599
content: The Act titled "Taxpayers' Cancer Research Funding Act of 2005" designates income tax payments to the Breast and Prostate Cancer Research Fund under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Taxpayers' Cancer Research Funding Act of 2005 allows individuals with an adjusted income tax liability of $5 or more to designate $5 to the Breast and Prostate Cancer Research Fund. For joint filers with a liability of $10 or more, each spouse can designate $5 to the fund. Adjusted income tax liability is the individual's income tax liability minus any previous designations. Individuals can designate $5 to the Breast and Prostate Cancer Research Fund under the Taxpayers' Cancer Research Funding Act of 2005. The designation can be made when filing the tax return or at a later time specified by the Secretary. Designation must be made as per regulations, either on the first page of the return or on the page with the taxpayer's signature. The Breast and Prostate Cancer Research Fund allows individuals to designate $5 under the Taxpayers' Cancer Research Funding Act of 2005 when filing their tax return. The Breast and Prostate Cancer Research Fund allows individuals to designate $5 under the Taxpayers' Cancer Research Funding Act of 2005 when filing their tax return. SEC. 9511 establishes the fund. A trust fund called the 'Breast and Prostate Cancer Research Fund' is created in the Treasury of the United States. It consists of appropriated amounts and is used for making qualified research grants to supplement existing funding. The 'Breast and Prostate Cancer Research Fund' in the Treasury of the United States provides grants for research on breast and prostate cancer, administered by the National Cancer Institute. Grants are awarded through qualified peer review processes. The table of parts for subchapter A of chapter 61 of the Code is amended by adding a new item. Part IX. Designation of Income Tax Payments to Breast and Prostate Cancer Research Fund. The table of sections for subchapter A of chapter 98 of the Code is amended by adding a new item: "Sec. 9511. Breast and Prostate Cancer Research Fund." The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2004.
